turn.1: What was the lead in the 1984 FA Cup Final?
turn.2: 1984 FA Cup Final The 1984 FA Cup Final was contested by Everton and Watford at Wembley.
turn.4: Everton won 2–0, with one goal by Graeme Sharp and a controversial goal from Andy Gray.
turn.6: He was adjudged by many to have fouled the Watford goalkeeper Steve Sherwood by heading the ball from Sherwood's hands.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Everton had reached the final seven times previously, winning in 1906, 1933 and 1966.
turn.9: Who had reached it the most?
turn.10: This was Watford's first FA Cup Final appearance.
turn.11: Did anyone else play in the finals?
turn.12: With the exception of Andy Gray (who had been a Football League Cup winner earlier in his career with Aston Villa and then Wolverhampton Wanderers), this was the first major honour that any of the Everton players in this match had collected.
